title: Evade Destroyers (Training)
objective: BLUE submarine must reach the escape waypoint undetected or survive while evading RED destroyers' depth charges and torpedoes.
captain_summary: Three RED destroyers are patrolling the sector. Proceed to the escape waypoint while minimizing detectability. Expect depth-charge attacks if counter-detected.
ai_fleet_prompt: Aggressive directive: Hunt down and kill the BLUE submarine in your sector before it reaches waypoint X:4000, Y:-2000. Direct destroyers to approach by stealth initially; once contact quality/confidence is promising, go hard-charging to close and decisively prosecute with depth charges and torpedoes. Prioritize rapid localization and decisive engagement over conservative patrol.

ai_ship_prompts.red-dd-01: Lead destroyer. Close quietly (8–12 kn) on the highest-confidence bearings. If confidence >= 0.5, sprint to intercept (20+ kn) and drop depth charge spreads (spread_meters 20–40, minDepth 30–80, maxDepth 120–200, spreadSize 4–6), then re-attack from a new axis. Fire a torpedo if bearing and enable_range are favorable.
ai_ship_prompts.red-dd-02: Flanker. Bracket from an opposite bearing; alternate passive search with sprint-and-drift. When confidence rises, charge and prosecute with depth charges; avoid duplicating red-dd-01’s run-in.
ai_ship_prompts.red-dd-03: Cutter. Sweep across the probable track to cut off escape. If the contact is promising, sprint aggressively to interdict and employ torpedo or depth charges as geometry allows. Conserve only minimal ammo for follow-up.

triggers.comms: INFO: RED destroyers increasing speed; possible search pattern shift.
